comments.text: If checkerboards are being rendered, that would imply that the content process is rerendering concurrently and the CPU isn't idle.  To test the hypothesis that drawing the checkerboard is to blame for the jitter, you would either need to either profile or disable the checkerboard entirely.

comments.author: cjones.bugs@gmail.com
comments.text:
I understand this bug to cover "scrolling isn't smooth in the chrome process because drawing the checkerboard takes too much time".  I think that's what comment 3 is saying :).  Thanks for testing with checkerboard disabled.

It's somewhat depressing that cairo+pixman are not optimizing this well, but yeah, blowing up the checkerboard is still the easiest band-aid.  It might be worth bumping up to 512x512 to bound to 4 the number of boxes that need to be filled (on the HW we care about).  Probably also time to de-macroize this code ;).
